cast.original_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1
cast.overview: Harry, Ron and Hermione walk away from their last year at Hogwarts to find and destroy the remaining Horcruxes, putting an end to Voldemort's bid for immortality. But with Harry's beloved Dumbledore dead and Voldemort's unscrupulous Death Eaters on the loose, the world is more dangerous than ever.
cast.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1

cast.original_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
cast.overview: Harry, Ron and Hermione continue their quest to vanquish the evil Voldemort once and for all. Just as things begin to look hopeless for the young wizards, Harry discovers a trio of magical objects that endow him with powers to rival Voldemort's formidable skills.
cast.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

cast.overview: In a world in which Great Britain has become a fascist state, a masked vigilante known only as “V” conducts guerrilla warfare against the oppressive British government. When V rescues a young woman from the secret police, he finds in her an ally with whom he can continue his fight to free the people of Britain.
cast.title: V for Vendetta

cast.original_title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
cast.overview: A rogue band of resistance fighters unite for a mission to steal the Death Star plans and bring a new hope to the galaxy.
cast.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story

details.biography:
Guy Henry (born 17 October 1960) is a British stage and screen actor, best known for his roles in Rome and John Adams. He appeared in Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows and from October 2010 he joined the cast of hospital drama Holby City as the new joint Director of Surgery Mr Henrik Hanssen.

Description above from the Wikipedia article Guy Henry, licensed under CC-BY-SA, full list of contributors on Wikipedia.
details.name: Guy Henry
